verses.roman:
kaiśora-vayase kāma, jagat-sakala
rāsādi-līlāya tina karila saphala

synonyms: kaiśora-vayase—in the adolescent age; kāma—amorous love; jagat-sakala—the entire universe; rāsa-ādi—such as the rāsa dance; līlāya—by pastimes; tina—three; karila—made; sa-phala—successful.
translation: In His youth Lord Kṛṣṇa made all three of His ages, and the entire universe, successful by His pastimes of amorous love like the rāsa dance.
